1.text: Masters, do to your servants that which is just and equal: knowing that you also have a master in heaven.

2.text: Be instant in prayer; watching in it with thanksgiving:

3.text: Praying withal for us also, that God may open unto us a door of speech to speak the mystery of Christ (for which also I am bound;)

4.text: That I may make it manifest as I ought to speak.

5.text: Walk with wisdom towards them that are without, redeeming the time.

6.text: Let your speech be always in grace seasoned with salt: that you may know how you ought to answer every man.

7.text: All the things that concern me, Tychicus, our dearest brother, and faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord, will make known to you,

8.text: Whom I have sent to you for this same purpose, that he may know the things that concern you, and comfort your hearts,

9.text: With Onesimus, a most beloved and faithful brother, who is one of you. All things that are done here, they shall make known to you.

10.text: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, saluteth you, and Mark, the cousin german of Barnabus, touching whom you have received commandments; if he come unto you, receive him:

11.text: And Jesus, that is called Justus: who are of the circumcision: these only are my helpers in the kingdom of God; who have been a comfort to me.

12.text: Epaphras saluteth you, who is one of you, a servant of Christ Jesus, who is always solicitous for you in prayers, that you may stand perfect, and full in all the will of God.

13.text: For I bear him testimony that he hath much labour for you, and for them that are at Laodicea, and them at Hierapolis.

14.text: Luke, the most dear physician, saluteth you: and Demas.

15.text: Salute the brethren who are at Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church that is in his house.

16.text: And when this epistle shall have been read with you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans: and that you read that which is of the Laodiceans.

17.text: And say to Archippus: Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.

18.text: The salutation of Paul with my own hand. Be mindful of my bands. Grace be with you. Amen
